image.altText: Hundreds of numbered grave markers, lined up in rows.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's Wolston Park Mental Hospital closed in 2001, but it has been the subject of a barrage of allegations of sexual abuse, beatings and chemical restraint from the 1950s to 1980s.

title.children: Investigation into notorious Brisbane mental health facility will aim to put names to unmarked graves of former patients

image.altText: Police have arrested the husband of Frances Crawford over her alleged murder

props.synopsis: Police have charged the husband of Frances Crawford with murder.

title.children: Husband of Queensland psychologist who died in apparent ride-on lawnmower incident charged with murder

image.altText: Man in scenic shot.

props.synopsis: Blake Wilson was killed when a helicopter he was flying crashed into the roof of the hotel on the Cairns Esplanade in August.

title.children: Pilot who crashed helicopter into roof of Cairns hotel was affected by alcohol, investigation finds

image.altText: A dark-haired woman stands in a unit near a window that overlooks a road.

props.synopsis: A man broke into this woman's home and raped her after she returned from a jog. She's challenging courts and prisons to do justice differently in the hope of curbing re-offending and putting survivors at the centre of the story.

title.children: Woman raped by a stranger in her own home finds justice meeting attacker in prison

image.altText: man smiles at camera standing in front of large truck

props.synopsis: The Toowoomba Bypass promised to fix the town's commute issues. But five years later, it remains only partially open, and prone to "close calls" for truck drivers.

title.children: Graeme's trucks travel on the Toowoomba Bypass up to 50 times each day, and every trip is a headache

image.altText: A selfie of a man

props.synopsis: Police say they have increased concerns for a man who disappeared in Queensland's South Burnett region after shoes were discovered as part of widespread search efforts.

title.children: Police say disappearance of man is 'increasingly concerning' after shoes discovered

image.altText: New laws for criminal bikie gangs

props.synopsis: Detectives say outlaw motorcycle gangs are "not welcome" on the Sunshine Coast, and have vowed to not let them gain a foothold.

title.children: Police arrest three suspected outlaw motorcycle gang members after car rammed, driver assaulted

image.altText: An aerial photo of kingfisher bay resort with the beach and barge

props.synopsis: A noxious pest from Africa has found its way onto the world's largest sand island, K’gari. Experts are calling for the invasive fish to be eradicated to stop it from threatening native species.

title.children: Aggressive fish invading waterways on popular Queensland tourist island

image.altText: An aerial shot of people standing on a roof, surrounded by floodwaters.

props.synopsis: The tiny town of Grantham in the Lockyer Valley was hit twice by devastating floods. Here's why it's still going strong.

title.children: We have to move the town: A mayor's bold plan to save his devastated community

image.altText: robbie katter frowning

props.synopsis: Less than a decade after abortion was decriminalised, the debate this time would be about whether to reinstate it as a criminal offence, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: Did a minor Queensland party just make abortion an election issue?

image.altText: Voters must now number every square on the ballot paper.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, Queensland Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: Queensland Votes 2024 — stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: Jandowae crop damage

props.synopsis: The SES has received 90 calls for help over the past 24 hours, predominantly from residents in the Moreton Bay area, north of Brisbane.

title.children: Severe thunderstorms lash south-east Queensland, bringing heavy rain, flash flooding and hail

image.altText: A woman holds her young daughter in a daycare playground

props.synopsis: After nearly 10 months and $180,000 in community-funded upgrades parents are rejoicing following the reopening of a childcare centre in a town where waitlists can stretch more than three years.

title.children: Outback community rallies to reopen run-down childcare centre amid three-year waitlists for parents

image.altText: A wide show of a beach overlooking a tropical bay

props.synopsis: Labor and LNP candidates in one of Queensland's most marginal state seats had dangled promises to purchase and conserve the coastal headland Taylor Point, but a private buyer has swooped in.

title.children: Mystery buyer reveals plans for multi-million-dollar tropical Cairns headland

image.altText: A middle-aged South Korean woman with long dark hair looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Han was recognsed by the Swedish Academy's Nobel Committee "for her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life".

title.children: South Korean author Han Kang awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature

image.altText: A small group of people in military uniforms look out from a watchtower.

props.synopsis: The allegation came after an Israeli air strike on a school sheltering displaced people in central Gaza killed at least 28 people on Thursday, including women and children, according to medics.

title.children: Israeli forces fire on UN peacekeeper positions in Lebanon, injuring two, UNIFIL says

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing at dispatch box in Parliament.

props.synopsis: Under pressure and reverting to his worst instincts, Anthony Albanese used Tourette syndrome as an insult in parliament. You just had to look at two of his ministers' faces to see how far he'd fouled.

title.children: Eyes darting, mouths open: You just had to look at his ministers' faces to see how far Albanese had fouled

image.altText: Sheila Raymond and family members

props.synopsis: Sheila Thurlow's family is calling for an inquest into her death at a Brisbane hospital after she was injected with 1,000 times the intended dose of morphine.

title.children: Nurse 'Googled' hospital procedure night before woman was given 1,000 times the intended level of morphine

image.altText: Trump Harris composite

props.synopsis: Professor Allan Lichtman is the "Nostradamus" of US politics. His system has seen him predict the winner of elections consistently since the 1980s and he believes this one is already in the bag.

title.children: 'It's governing, not campaigning, that counts': Is the race for the White House already over?

image.altText: A drone and machine parts scattered in a room.

props.synopsis: To fill an urgent labour shortage in wartime Russia, the Kremlin has been recruiting women aged 18-22 from places like Uganda, Rwanda, Kenya, South Sudan, Sierra Leone and Nigeria, as well as the South Asian country of Sri Lanka.

title.children: Africans recruited to work in Russia say they were duped into building drones for use in Ukraine

image.altText: A family of four embrace in outback Australia

props.synopsis: Outback tourism operators are feeling the squeeze as soaring costs and increasing global competition cut into visitor numbers.

title.children: This Queensland family sold their home to experience outback Australia

image.altText: Yung Filly smiling on stage holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: British YouTube personality and rapper Yung Filly is granted bail by a Perth court after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in his hotel room following a show at a Perth nightclub.

title.children: British rapper Yung Filly bailed after being charged with sexually assaulting woman in Perth hotel room

image.altText: A boy stands in a doorway while a police car with flashing lights is parked outside.

props.synopsis: Claire thought that she'd escaped domestic violence after leaving her abusive partner, but she then struggled to find help with the violent meltdowns from her trauma-affected son.

title.children: Claire's son had violent meltdowns so bad she called the police. Here's what she wished she knew then

image.altText: Adam John Charles Evans

props.synopsis: The court heard Adam John Charles Evans and another man dumped the victim's mobility scooter in the Brisbane River after stuffing his body in a wheelie bin.

title.children: Brisbane man who bashed Kym Mitchell to death and put his body in a wheelie bin jailed for 18 years

image.altText: Drone shot of a house missing a roof with debris scattered around it.

props.synopsis: While hurricanes, typhoons and cyclones are one and the same, different names are used to determine the location of origin.

title.children: Hurricane Milton made landfall as a category three storm. Here's what that classification means

image.altText: Palm trees sway as a car drives during heavy rain

props.synopsis: Flash flooding warnings and a federal disaster declaration are in place as the dangerous storm makes its way off Florida's east coast.

title.children: 'We have lost some life,' says Florida county sheriff as Hurricane Milton floods state

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks downwards.

props.synopsis: A senior staffer to Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles has alleged she was forced out of her job after raising an internal bullying complaint.

title.children: Deputy PM's top staffer says she was forced out of her job after raising a bullying complaint

image.altText: A woman with long black hair and a bindi on her forehead smiles.

props.synopsis: The ACT Greens leader says they will not disendorse a candidate for Murrumbidgee, Harini Rangarajan, who made a blog post in 2023 comparing Osama bin Laden to Jesus Christ, in the upcoming territory election.

title.children: ACT Greens leader says candidate's blog post comparing Osama bin Laden to Jesus Christ is 'not a reflection of our party as a whole'

image.altText: Albanese meets Li Qiang China

props.synopsis: The prime minister received an assurance from Chinese Premier Li Qiang at a meeting in Laos.

title.children: Chinese trade restrictions on Australian lobsters to be lifted before Chinese New Year

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe addresses the media wearing a suit and red glasses

props.synopsis: Andrew O'Keefe entered early guilty pleas to violating and AVO after he went to a Point Piper home in July.

title.children: Former TV host at his 'final crossroads' after sentencing for breaching AVO and meth possession

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the club have refuted claims made by its Indigenous former players, calling the allegations "vague and embarrassing".

title.children: Hawthorn Football Club prepares to fight claims of 'racist culture' in Federal Court

image.altText: Bunnings store sign

props.synopsis: Bunnings is Australia's most trusted brand. But allegations the hardware chain has been abusing its market power have prompted a Senate inquiry that is set to scrutinise the market power of many large format retailers.

title.children: 'Too big, too powerful?' Main Bunnings competitor lashes out about the hardware chain's dominance

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding a phone. It is superimposed on a drawing of Australia and surrounded by social media apps

props.synopsis: As a social media summit this week discusses the merits of Australia's proposed world-leading ban for teenagers, Ange Lavoipierre asks: why have so few others made it down this path?

title.children: No other government has enforced a total ban for teenagers on social media — so why does Australia think it can?
